histogram.name: Crypto.TPMDuration.Virtual.{Operation}{SignatureAlgorithm}
histogram.summary: Collected on Windows at startup. Records status for various virtual TPM operations that Chrome artificially triggers on startup for measurement purposes. Note that if new key creation fails, wrapped key creation and message signing will not take place.

histogram.name: Crypto.TPMDuration.{Operation}{SignatureAlgorithm}
histogram.summary: Collected on Windows at startup. Records status for various TPM operations that Chrome artificially triggers on startup for measurement purposes. Note that if new key creation fails, wrapped key creation and message signing will not take place.

histogram.name: Crypto.TpmError.VirtualCreateKey
histogram.summary: Error code returned by NCryptCreatePersistedKey. One of the error codes from https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/com/com-error-codes-4.

histogram.name: Crypto.TpmError.VirtualFinalizeKey
histogram.summary: Error code returned by NCryptFinalizeKey. One of the error codes from https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/com/com-error-codes-4.

histogram.name: Crypto.TpmError.VirtualOpenKey
histogram.summary: Error code returned by NCryptOpenKey. One of the error codes from https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/com/com-error-codes-4.

histogram.name: Crypto.TpmError.VirtualOpenStorage
histogram.summary: Error code returned by NCryptOpenStorageProvider. One of the error codes from https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/com/com-error-codes-4.

histogram.name: Crypto.TPMOperation.Virtual.{Operation}{SignatureAlgorithm}
histogram.summary: Collected on Windows at startup. Records status for various virtual TPM actions that Chrome artificially triggers on startup for measurement purposes. Note that if new key creation fails, wrapped key creation and message signing will not take place.

histogram.name: Crypto.TPMOperation.{Operation}{SignatureAlgorithm}
histogram.summary: Collected on Windows at startup. Records status for various TPM actions that Chrome artificially triggers on startup for measurement purposes. Note that if new key creation fails, wrapped key creation and message signing will not take place.

histogram.name: Crypto.TPMSupport2
histogram.summary: Collected on Windows at startup. Records whether a TPM is present and, if so, what the best supported algorithm is.

histogram.name: Crypto.TPMSupportType
histogram.summary: Collected on Windows at startup. Records whether a virtual and/or hardware TPM is present.

histogram.name: Crypto.UnexportableKeys.BackgroundTaskDuration{Priority}
histogram.summary:
Records the time that passed between starting a TPM operation on an unexportable_keys::UnexportableKeyService and completing the operation (either successfully or not).
This time includes both the time spent waiting in a task queue and the execution time. These sub-intervals are covered by Crypto.UnexportableKeys.BackgroundTaskQueueWaitDuration and Crypto.UnexportableKeys.BackgroundTaskRunDuration histograms correspondingly.
Includes operations that were scheduled with {Priority}.
Recorded right after a TPM operation completes.

histogram.name: Crypto.UnexportableKeys.BackgroundTaskQueueWaitDuration{Priority}
histogram.summary:
Records the time spent waiting in a task queue for the subset of TPM operations that are asynchronously scheduled through unexportable_keys::UnexportableKeyService.
This duration is a sub-interval of Crypto.UnexportableKeys.BackgroundTaskDuration.
Includes operations that were scheduled with {Priority}.
Recorded right before a TPM operation is sent to the background thread for execution.

histogram.name: Crypto.UnexportableKeys.BackgroundTaskResult{TaskType}
histogram.summary:
Records the result of the subset of TPM operations that are scheduled asynchronously through unexportable_keys::UnexportableKeyService. In some error cases, the result might be returned synchronously.
Recorded right after a TPM operation completes. Recorded only for {TaskType}.

variant.name: .FromWrappedKey
variant.summary: operations to create a signing key from a wrapped key

variant.name: .GenerateKey
variant.summary: operations to generate a new signing key

histogram.name: Crypto.UnexportableKeys.BackgroundTaskRunDuration{TaskType}
histogram.summary:
Records the time that passed between starting executing a TPM operation on a background thread and completing the operation (either successfully or not). Includes only a subset of TPM operations that are scheduled asynchronously through unexportable_keys::UnexportableKeyService.
This duration is a sub-interval of Crypto.UnexportableKeys.BackgroundTaskDuration. Unlike Crypto.UnexportableKeys.BackgroundTaskDuration, this histogram is split by a task type instead of a task priority because the priority doesn't matter once a task starts executing. Only one task can be executed at the time due to TPM limitations.
Includes {TaskType}.
Recorded right after a TPM operation completes.

variant.name: .FromWrappedKey
variant.summary: only operations to create a signing key from a wrapped key

variant.name: .GenerateKey
variant.summary: only operations to generate a new signing key

histogram.name: Crypto.VirtualKeySupport
histogram.summary: Collected on Windows at startup. Records whether a virtual TPM is present and, if so, what the best supported algorithm is.

histogram.name: HttpCache.AccessToDone
histogram.summary: For every http cache transaction with a pattern (see HttpCache.Pattern), the time from the first access to the disk cache until the transaction was done.

histogram.name: HttpCache.AddTransactionToEntry
histogram.summary: The time taken an HttpCache::Transaction to be added to ActiveEntry. It roughly captures time to acquire a write lock for an disk cache. Recorded every time a transaction (re)starts. Not recorded if the cache is memory-backed.

histogram.name: HttpCache.BeforeSend
histogram.summary: For http cache transactions in which a network request was sent, the time elapsed between beginning the request and sending it over the network; this is the time spent accessing the disk cache.

histogram.name: HttpCache.CreateDiskEntry
histogram.summary: The time taken to create a disk cache entry. Recorded when the entry is created for the first time in the HttpCacheTransaction. Not recorded if the cache is memory-backed.

histogram.name: HttpCache.IsNoStore{Type}
histogram.summary: Whether or not a response has `Cache-Control: no-store`. Recorded when a HTTP transaction is finished. This histogram is for {Type}.

histogram.name: HttpCache.MaxFileSizeOnInit
histogram.summary: Max file size allowed to be cached in the http cache. This is logged at the time the backend is created.

histogram.name: HttpCache.OpenDiskEntry
histogram.summary: The time taken to open a disk cache entry. Recorded when the entry is created for the first time in the HttpCacheTransaction. Not recorded if the cache is memory-backed.

histogram.name: HttpCache.Pattern
histogram.summary: For each http cache transaction, the recorded pattern.

histogram.name: HttpCache.TotalDiskCacheTimePerTransaction.{AccessType}
histogram.summary: For each HTTP cache transaction, record total time spent {AccessType} the disk cache. Recorded when a transaction finished. This histogram does not record partial requests.

histogram.name: Net.AlternateProtocolBrokenLocation
histogram.summary: Breakdown of the locations when SetBrokenAlternateProtocol is called.

histogram.name: Net.AlternateProtocolUsage
histogram.summary: Breakdown of how requests which could potentially make use of an alternate protocol use or don't use the protocol.

histogram.name: Net.AlternateProtocolUsageGoogle
histogram.summary: Breakdown of how requests which could potentially make use of an alternate protocol use or don't use the protocol, for connections to Google servers.

histogram.name: Net.AlternateServiceFailed
histogram.summary: Positive net error codes that failed alternative protocol requests end with. Recorded only when an alternative job fails, and the main job succeeds.

histogram.name: Net.AlternateServiceForDnsAlpnH3Failed
histogram.summary: Positive net error codes that failed alternative protocol requests end with. Recorded only when an DNS alpn H3 job fails, and the main job succeeds.

histogram.name: Net.AlternativeServiceTypeForRequest
histogram.summary: Information about the AlternativeService used for each request.

histogram.name: Net.Certificate.ChangeNotification
histogram.summary:
Recorded each time a platform certificate change notification occurs. (Note that on Linux and ChromeOS these events are generated by the Chrome Certificate Manager but there are no notifications for changes that occurred outside of Chrome, and on Windows there are no notifications at all.)
This does not count internal changes like Chrome Root Store and CRLSet updates.

histogram.name: Net.Certificate.IgnoreCertificateErrorsSPKIListPresent
histogram.summary: Whether certificate validation was disabled for a set of public keys because the --ignore-certificate-errors-spki-list switch was set on startup.

histogram.name: Net.Certificate.IgnoreErrors
histogram.summary: Whether certificate validation was disabled because the --ignore-certificate-errors switch was set on startup.

histogram.name: Net.Certificate.TLSFeatureExtensionWithPrivateRoot
histogram.summary: This histogram is recorded every time Chrome successfully verifies a certificate that chains to a private root. A value of true indicates that the certificate contains the TLS Feature Extension, and false indicates that it doesn't.

histogram.name: Net.Certificate.TLSFeatureExtensionWithPrivateRootHasOCSP
histogram.summary: This histogram is recorded every time Chrome successfully verifies a certificate that chains to a private root and the certificate contains the TLS Feature Extension. A value of true indicates that the connection had an OCSP response stapled, and a value of false indicates that it did not.

histogram.name: Net.Certificate.TrustAnchor.Request
histogram.summary: The SHA-256 hash of the subjectPublicKeyInfo of the most-specific trust anchor encountered in a successfully-verified certificate chain, during an HTTP URL request. The associated root certificate can be looked up using https://crt.sh/?spkisha256= .

histogram.name: Net.Certificate.TrustAnchor.Verify
histogram.summary: The SHA-256 hash of the subjectPublicKeyInfo of the most-specific trust anchor encountered in a successfully-verified certificate chain, during verification time. The associated root certificate can be looked up using https://crt.sh/?spkisha256= .

histogram.name: Net.Certificate.TrustAnchor.VerifyOutOfDate
histogram.summary: This histogram is recorded every time Chrome successfully validates a certificate, but cannot determine a public trust anchor from the verified chain. A value of true indicates that the trust anchor list is out of date, as the OS believes a public trust anchor is being used, but the built-in list does not know about this trust anchor, while a value of false indicates that a public trust anchor was not used, thus there is no evidence that the list is out of date. This histogram is temporary until the transition to a unified root store (in source), at which point, the OS store will no longer be consulted for known roots.

histogram.name: Net.CertificateTransparency.SCTOrigin
histogram.summary: The origin breakdown of Signed Certificate Timestamps (SCTs). Emitted once for every SCT when first validated, which means 0 or more times during every SSL connection establishment.

histogram.name: Net.CertificateTransparency.SCTStatus
histogram.summary: Breakdown of Signed Certificate Timestamps (SCTs) validation status. Emitted once for every SCT when first validated, which means 0 or more times during every SSL connection establishment.

histogram.name: Net.CertVerifier.AndroidTrustStoreInit
histogram.summary: Time needed to initialize the Android platform Trust store when using the builtin certificate verifier on Android.

histogram.name: Net.CertVerifier.InvalidRsaPssParams
histogram.summary: While parsing an RSASSA-PSS signature algorithm, whether any invalid parameters were encountered that currently are not enforced as parsing errors.

histogram.name: Net.CertVerifier.MacKeychainCerts.IntermediateCacheInitTime
histogram.summary:
When initializing the builtin certificate verifier on Mac using the DomainCacheFullCerts implementation of the system trust store integration, this records how long it took to query the Mac keychain and initialize the cache of intermediate certificates.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-04-09 to 2023-06-07(M116); data may be missing.

histogram.name: Net.CertVerifier.MacKeychainCerts.IntermediateCount
histogram.summary: When initializing the builtin certificate verifier on Mac using the DomainCacheFullCerts or KeychainCacheFullCerts implementation of the system trust store integration, this records the number of certificates that were included in the cache of intermediate certificates.

histogram.name: Net.CertVerifier.MacKeychainCerts.TotalCount
histogram.summary: When initializing the builtin certificate verifier on Mac using the DomainCacheFullCerts or KeychainCacheFullCerts implementation of the system trust store integration, this records the number of certificates found in the Mac keychain.

histogram.name: Net.CertVerifier.MacKeychainCerts.TrustCount
histogram.summary: When initializing the builtin certificate verifier on Mac using the KeychainCacheFullCerts implementation of the system trust store integration, this records the number of certificates found in the Mac keychain which had trust records marking them as either trusted or distrusted.

histogram.name: Net.CertVerifier.MacTrustDomainCacheInitTime
histogram.summary: When the builtin certificate verifier is used on Mac and the platform trusted certificates cache is initialized (or re-initialized if keychain trust settings changed), records how long it took to initialize all the trust domain caches. Only recorded by the DomainCacheFullCerts implementation, which may or may not be used depending on Finch trial parameters.

histogram.name: Net.CertVerifier.MacTrustDomainCertCount.{Domain}
histogram.summary:
When the builtin certificate verifier is used on Mac and the platform trusted certificates cache is initialized (or re-initialized if keychain trust settings changed), records the number of certificates read from the {Domain} trust domain. Only counts certificates that were successfully parsed. Only recorded by the DomainCacheFullCerts implementation, which may or may not be used depending on Finch trial parameters.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-04-09 to 2023-06-07(M116); data may be missing.

histogram.name: Net.CertVerifier.MacTrustImplCacheInitTime
histogram.summary: When the builtin certificate verifier is used on Mac and the platform trusted certificates cache is initialized (or re-initialized if keychain trust settings changed), records how long it took to initialize both the trust cache and the intermediates cache. Only recorded by the DomainCacheFullCerts and KeychainCacheFullCerts implementations, which may or may not be used depending on Finch trial parameters.

histogram.name: Net.CertVerifier.NameNormalizationPrivateRoots
histogram.summary: Whether Name normalization was used in successfully validated certificate chains, only recorded for chains ending in privately trusted roots. Suffixed by the CertVerifyProc implementation.

histogram.name: Net.CertVerifier.PathBuilderIterationCount
histogram.summary: When using the builtin cert verifier, records the number of iterations taken during path building for each attempted verification.

histogram.name: Net.CertVerifier_First_Job_Latency
histogram.summary: The actual amount of time spent verifying a certificate using the underlying cryptographic APIs. Because parallel verifications for the same certificate may be coalesced, histograms such as Net.SSLCertVerificationTime may be skewed, due to later verifications taking less overall time. This records the overall time spent verifying the first job to capture initialization costs.

histogram.name: Net.CertVerifier_Job_Latency
histogram.summary: The actual amount of time spent verifying a certificate using the underlying cryptographic APIs. Because parallel verifications for the same certificate may be coalesced, histograms such as Net.SSLCertVerificationTime may be skewed, due to later verifications taking less overall time. This records the overall time spent verifying a single request, regardless of how many parallel requests are being served by the verification.

histogram.name: Net.ConnectionInfo.MainFrame
histogram.summary: Application protocol used for main frame resources. Logged by the renderer only for request that accessed the network and have received response headers.

histogram.name: Net.ConnectionInfo.SubResource
histogram.summary: Application protocol used for subresources (resources other than main frame). Logged by the renderer only for request that accessed the network and have received response headers.

histogram.name: Net.ContentDecodingFailed2
histogram.summary: For each CONTENT_DECODING_FAILED, record the filter that failed.

histogram.name: Net.ContentEncodingType
histogram.summary: For each response stream, record the Content-Encoding type. If multiple encoding types are specified, this histogram only records the last one. Note: Compression Dictionary Transport headers (i.e. "sbr" for Shared Brotli) will be recorded as "Unknown" in this histogram.

histogram.name: Net.Cors.PreflightCheckError2
histogram.summary: The distribution of CORS error types on preflight requests. This reports whenever CORS checks detect an error on a preflight request. The InvalidResponse case corresponds to net errors for which there was no CORS error, e.g. CONNECTION_REFUSED, NX_DOMAIN, etc.

histogram.name: Net.Cors.PreflightCheckWarning
histogram.summary: The distribution of CORS error types on preflight requests which are treated as warnings. This reports whenever CORS checks detect an error on a preflight request without failing the whole original network request, due to being configured to ignore these failures.

histogram.name: Net.CountOfBrokenAlternativeServices
histogram.summary: The number of broken alternative services loaded from the prefs file on startup. Alternative services allow an origin server to specify additional means of interacting with it on the network. A broken alternative service is one whose most recent connection attempt failed and whose retry timeout period has not yet expired. Recorded when broken alternative services are loaded from the prefs file on startup.

histogram.name: Net.CountOfQuicServerInfos
histogram.summary: This counts the number of server configs persisted in prefs file.

histogram.name: Net.CountOfRecentlyBrokenAlternativeServices
histogram.summary: The number of recently broken alternative services loaded from the prefs file on startup. Alternative services allow an origin server to specify additional means of interacting with it on the network. A recently broken alternative service is one whose most recent connection attempt failed. Recorded when broken alternative services are loaded from the prefs file on startup.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsConfig.AdditionalDnsQueryTypesEnabled
histogram.summary: Whether or not `prefs::kAdditionalDnsQueryTypesEnabled` is enabled. Recorded at startup if disabled or whenever Chrome is believed to be enterprise-managed (per the same detection as the default disabling of DoH). Measures whether or not enterprise admins are setting the disable, potentially due to issues encoutered with HTTPS/INTEGRITY query experiments.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsConfig.Nsswitch.Compatible
histogram.summary: Whether or not the DNS configuration read from a nsswitch.conf file is considered compatible with Chrome, that is that the configuration did not contain any options that Chrome is unable to support using the built-in resolver. Reported whenever a nsswitch.conf file is read by Chrome.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsConfig.Nsswitch.FileChange
histogram.summary: Counter enum recorded whenever `net::DnsConfigService` detects a change to the nsswitch.conf DNS configuration file.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsConfig.Nsswitch.HostsFound
histogram.summary: Whether or not the "hosts:" database was found in an nsswitch.conf DNS configuration file. Reported whenever Chrome has successfully read the nsswitch.conf file and is beginning to attempt to parse it.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsConfig.Nsswitch.IncompatibleService
histogram.summary: Enumeration of the nsswitch.conf service that caused a compatibility issue, leading to the nsswitch.conf DNS configuration being considered incompatible with Chrome. Only emitted when a specific token is present in the nsswitch.conf file, causing the incompatibility, e.g. because the service is always incompatible with Chrome or because the service is configured with incompatible actions.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsConfig.Nsswitch.NisServiceInHosts
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2022-20. As of M108, NIS is treated as incompatible. Instances where it was the cause of incompatibility will be recorded in Net.DNS.DnsConfig.Nsswitch.IncompatibleService.
histogram.summary: Whether or not NIS service is registered in the "hosts:" database of an nsswitch.conf. Recorded when a resolv.conf file is successfully read by Chrome and the DNS configuration read from the resolv.conf file is considered compatible with Chrome.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsConfig.Nsswitch.Read
histogram.summary: Whether or not an attempt to read nsswitch.conf succeeded. May fail due to missing file or filesystem issues, but does not consider it a failure if the file is larger than the size limit (see Net.DNS.DnsConfig.Nsswitch.TooLarge for that case). Reported for all attempts to read nsswitch.conf.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsConfig.Nsswitch.TooLarge
histogram.summary: Whether or not an attempt to read nsswitch.conf failed due to the file size being unreasonably large. Reported for all attempts to read nsswitch.conf.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsConfig.Resolv.Compatible
histogram.summary: Whether or not the DNS configuration read from a resolv.conf file is considered compatible with Chrome, that is that the configuration did not contain any options that Chrome is unable to support using the built-in resolver. Reported whenever a resolv.conf file is successfully read by Chrome.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsConfig.Resolv.FileChange
histogram.summary: Counter enum recorded whenever `net::DnsConfigService` detects a change to the resolv.conf DNS configuration file.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsConfig.Resolv.Read
histogram.summary: Whether or not an attempt to read resolv.conf succeeded and produced a `__res_state` struct for Chrome to attempt to use. Reported on all attempts to read the configuration.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsConfig.Resolv.Valid
histogram.summary: Whether or not the DNS configuration read from a resolv.conf file is considered "valid", that is that it contains at least one DNS server. Reported whenever a resolv.conf file is successfully read by Chrome.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsConfig.SecureDnsMode
histogram.summary: Records details of the secure DNS mode used to configure the host resolver at construction of the network service.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsConfig.Windows.Compatibility
histogram.summary: Enumeration of whether or not the DNS configuration setting of Windows is considered compatible with Chrome and the reason why it is considered incompatible. Reported whenever the DNS configuration setting of Windows is read by Chrome.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsHosts.Count
histogram.summary: The number of hosts parsed from a Hosts file. Reported whenever a Hosts file is read and parsed.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsHosts.EstimateMemoryUsage
histogram.summary: Estimated memory usage to keep the parsed result of a Hosts file. Reported whenever a Hosts file is read and parsed.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsHosts.FileSize
histogram.summary: The file size of a Hosts file. Reported whenever a Hosts file is read.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsTask.AdditionalHttps.Requested
histogram.summary: Status of HTTPS DNS records received as additional records in a DnsTask querying for HTTPS. This would represent a recurssive resolver that is HTTPS-aware and performing followup queries on behalf of the client. Recorded as DNS responses are parsed.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsTask.AdditionalHttps.Unsolicited
histogram.summary: Status of HTTPS DNS records received as additional records in a DnsTask querying for a type other than HTTPS. Recorded as DNS responses are parsed.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsTask.Errors
histogram.summary: Counts of specific error codes returned by DnsTask if a subsequent HostResolverSystemTask succeeded.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsTask.SuccessTime
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by DnsTask (the grouping of all individual DNS queries for a single instance of resolving a name) in resolutions that succeeded.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsTask.SvcbHttpsTransactionError
histogram.summary: Enumeration of whether or not an HTTPS (SVCB) record transaction succeeded and whether or not any failure is fatal to the DnsTask. Recorded for all completed HTTPS record transactions.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsTransaction.AttemptType
histogram.summary: Enumeration of the logic path used (e.g. different protocols) for each started DnsAttempt (the representation of an individual network request to a DNS server).

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsTransaction.Insecure.FailureTime
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by an insecure DnsTransaction to fail.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsTransaction.Insecure.SuccessTime
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by an insecure DnsTransaction to succeed.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsTransaction.SecureNotValidated.FailureError
histogram.summary: Counts of specific error codes returned by secure DnsTransactions to a DoH server that is unavailable or has unknown availability. These transactions may be probe queries or queries issued in the secure DNS mode.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsTransaction.SecureNotValidated.FailureTime
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by a secure DnsTransaction to a DoH server that is unavailable or has unknown availability to fail. These transactions may be probe queries or queries issued in the secure DNS mode.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsTransaction.SecureNotValidated.SuccessTime
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by a secure DnsTransaction to a DoH server that is unavailable or has unknown availability to succeed. These transactions may be probe queries or queries issued in the secure DNS mode.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsTransaction.SecureValidated.FailureError
histogram.summary: Counts of specific error codes returned by secure DnsTransactions to an available DoH server. A DoH server is available if a probe has been successfully completed and fewer than a threshold amount of failures have occurred.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsTransaction.SecureValidated.FailureTime
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by a secure DnsTransaction to an available DoH server to fail. A DoH server is available if a probe has been successfully completed and fewer than a threshold amount of failures have occurred.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsTransaction.SecureValidated.SuccessTime
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by a secure DnsTransaction to an available DoH server to succeed. A DoH server is available if a probe has been successfully completed and fewer than a threshold amount of failures have occurred.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.DnsTransaction.UDP.LowEntropyReason
histogram.summary: Enumerated status of the reason why the built-in DNS resolver has detected a "low entropy" situation for DNS over UDP and has switched to DNS over TCP.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.H3SupportedGoogleHost.TaskTypeMetadataAvailability
histogram.summary: The succeeded DNS Task type of HostResolverManager::Job (the basic internal unit of work for non-local host resolutions, potentially merging redundant requests from Chrome) that succeeded with or without valid HTTPS DNS metadata. This is recorded when a DNS Job succeeded for a domain if the domain is one of Google hosts which that is expected to have valid HTTPS DNS metadata with HTTP/3 support.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.H3SupportedGoogleHost.TaskTypeMetadataAvailability2
histogram.summary: The succeeded DNS Task type of HostResolverManager::Job (the basic internal unit of work for non-local host resolutions, potentially merging redundant requests from Chrome) that succeeded with or without valid HTTPS DNS metadata. This is recorded for successful https- or wss-schemed queries to a set of Google hosts expected to have HTTPS DNS metadata, if the query type requests the HTTPS record.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.HTTPSSVC.RecordHttps.{secure}.ExpectNoerror.DnsRcode
histogram.summary: Records which RCODE the DNS server specified when it responded to our HTTPS query. If the query timed out before getting a response, "TimedOut" is recorded instead of an RCODE value. Histograms are emitted at the completion of a DnsTask's final transaction.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.HTTPSSVC.RecordHttps.{secure}.ExpectNoerror.Parsable
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the result of an HTTPS query was validly parsable or mangled. Only recorded when DnsRcode indicates NoError. Histograms are emitted at the completion of a DnsTask's final transaction.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.HTTPSSVC.RecordHttps.{secure}.ExpectNoerror.RecordWithError
histogram.summary: Records true when we receive an HTTPS record and an error RCODE at the same time. Only recorded for true. Histograms are emitted at the completion of a DnsTask's final transaction.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.HTTPSSVC.RecordHttps.{secure}.ExpectNoerror.ResolveTimeAddressRecord
histogram.summary: Records how many ms the DNS server took to respond to address queries. Histograms are emitted at the completion of a DnsTask's final transaction.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.HTTPSSVC.RecordHttps.{secure}.ExpectNoerror.ResolveTimeExperimental
histogram.summary: Records how many ms the DNS server took to respond to an HTTPS query. Histograms are emitted at the completion of a DnsTask's final transaction.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.HTTPSSVC.RecordHttps.{secure}.ExpectNoerror.ResolveTimeRatio
histogram.summary: Records a ratio indicating the relative HTTPS query resolve time compared to the slower A or AAAA resolve time, where A/AAAA/HTTPS belong to the same DnsTask. Multiply this value by 10 to obtain a percentage P. The HTTPS query completed in roughly P% of the slower A/AAAA resolve time. Values smaller than 10 indicate that HTTPS query was faster than A/AAAA. Values larger than 10 indicate that the HTTPS query was slower than A/AAAA. Histograms are emitted at the completion of a DnsTask's final transaction.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.InsecureDnsTask.FailureTime
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by an insecure DnsTask in resolutions that failed.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.JobQueueTime.Failure
histogram.summary: The duration of time DnsTransactions spend waiting to be started by a DnsTask, aggregated by HostResolverManager::Job. This metric is only recorded when the Job failed.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.JobQueueTime.PerTransaction
histogram.summary: The duration of time a DnsTransaction spends waiting to be started by a DnsTask. The dominant factor is likely the time spent waiting for other DnsTransactions to complete, i.e. waiting for DnsTask::StartNextTransaction to be invoked by the dispatcher. If there were no limit on the number of concurrent DNS queries, we would expect this metric to be near zero.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.JobQueueTime.Success
histogram.summary: The duration of time DnsTransactions spend waiting to be started by a DnsTask, aggregated by HostResolverManager::Job. This metric is only recorded when the Job succeeded.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.ProbeSequence.ConfigChange.Failure.AttemptTime
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by a probe attempt to fail. The time is measured since the probe sequence was initiated due to a DNS config change.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.ProbeSequence.ConfigChange.Success.AttemptTime
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by a probe attempt to succeed. The time is measured since the probe sequence was initiated due to a DNS config change.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.ProbeSequence.NetworkChange.Failure.AttemptTime
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by a probe attempt to fail. The time is measured since the probe sequence was initiated due to a network change.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.ProbeSequence.NetworkChange.Success.AttemptTime
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by a probe attempt to succeed. The time is measured since the probe sequence was initiated due to a network change.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.Request.TotalTime
histogram.summary: Duration of HostResolver requests from Start() until completion. Includes requests resolved synchronously using fast local sources, e.g. from cache, recorded as 0. Excludes speculative requests.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.Request.TotalTimeAsync
histogram.summary: Duration of HostResolver requests from Start() until completion. Excludes speculative requests and requests resolved using fast local sources, e.g. from cache.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.ResolveCategory
histogram.summary: Whether a HostResolverManager::Job (the basic internal unit of work for non-local host resolutions, potentially merging redundant requests from Chrome) succeeded or failed, and whether it was speculative.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.ResolveContext.DohAutoupgrade.Status
histogram.summary: The state of the Secure DNS (DoH) auto-upgrade functionality. This histogram is only emitted by clients with secure DNS set to automatic mode, and the emission occurs one minute after the insecure DNS to secure DNS auto-upgrade network probing begins. There will be one histogram emission per DoH provider in the system DNS configuration per NetworkContext that allows using secure DNS queries, and re-emissions can occur each time the DNS configuration changes.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.ResolveError.Fast
histogram.summary: For DNS resolutions that failed after less than 10 ms, which are probably local failures, what error code the jobs failed with.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.ResolveError.Slow
histogram.summary: For DNS resolutions that failed after at least 10 ms, which are probably remote failures or connectivity problems, what error code the jobs failed with.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.ResolveFailureTime
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by HostResolverManager::Job (the basic internal unit of work for non-local host resolutions, potentially merging redundant requests from Chrome) in resolutions that failed. This is the time to resolve a hostname from start to finish. Excludes jobs where all requests are speculative.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.ResolveSuccessTime
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by HostResolverManager::Job (the basic internal unit of work for non-local host resolutions, potentially merging redundant requests from Chrome) in resolutions that succeeded. This is the time to resolve a hostname from start to finish. Excludes jobs where all requests are speculative.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.ResolveTimeDiff.AddressRecordBeforeHTTPS.{Bucket}
histogram.summary: Time difference between the first address record (A or AAAA) and HTTPS record were resolved. Recorded when an address record was resolved before HTTPS record and the address record was resolved {Bucket}.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.ResolveTimeDiff.{Variant}.{Bucket}
histogram.summary: Time difference between A and AAAA records were resolved. Recorded when {Variant}, and the first one was resolved {Bucket}.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.SystemTask.FailureTime
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by HostResolverSystemTask (the grouping of all individual DNS queries for a single instance of resolving a name using the system resolver) in resolutions that failed.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.SystemTask.SuccessTime
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by HostResolverSystemTask (the grouping of all individual DNS queries for a single instance of resolving a name using the system resolver) in resolutions that succeeded.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.UI.ProbeAttemptSuccess
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of a DoH probe attempt on the first valid entry in the custom text field.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.UI.ValidationAttemptSuccess
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of a formatting validation attempt on the custom text field.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.UpgradeConfig.DotUpgradeSucceeded
histogram.summary: True if upgrade to DoH from a DoT hostname was attempted and succeeded. False if it was attempted and failed.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.UpgradeConfig.HasPublicInsecureNameserver
histogram.summary:
True if there was at least one public nameserver during an attempt to upgrade to DoH from insecure DNS. False if there were no public nameservers during an attempt to upgrade to DoH from insecure DNS.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-04-23 to 2023-06-12; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.UpgradeConfig.Ineligible.DohSpecified
histogram.summary: True if upgrade to DoH was not attempted because the DoH config was already specified. False if upgrade to DoH was not attempted for some other reason.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.UpgradeConfig.Ineligible.UnhandledOptions
histogram.summary: True if upgrade to DoH was not attempted because of unhandled options in the system config. False if upgrade to DoH was not attempted for some other reason. Emitted each time the DnsConfig is updated.

histogram.name: Net.DNS.UpgradeConfig.InsecureUpgradeSucceeded
histogram.summary: True if upgrade to DoH from insecure DNS was attempted and succeeded. False if it was attempted and failed.

histogram.name: Net.DNS_Resolution_And_TCP_Connection_Latency2
histogram.summary: The time measured before starting DNS lookup until after the connection is complete.

histogram.name: Net.DomainReliability.BeaconOutcome
histogram.summary: The outcome of a Domain Reliability beacon, logged upon destruction of the beacon.

histogram.name: Net.ErrorCodesForHTTPSGoogleMainFrame3
histogram.summary: Positive net error codes that requests for pages end with, including net::OK and net::ERR_ABORTED. This only counts loads in "main frames" for https://www.google.com (it does not for example count the error codes for subresoures on a page). It excludes main frame navigations that are converted to downloads (unless they fail / are aborted before it's known that they would be a download), and requests handled externally (like mailto links).

histogram.name: Net.ErrorCodesForIsolatedAppScheme
histogram.summary: Positive net error codes that HTTP requests using the isolated-app: URL scheme end with, including net::OK and net::ERR_ABORTED.

histogram.name: Net.ErrorCodesForMainFrame4
histogram.summary: Positive net error codes that requests for pages end with, including net::OK and net::ERR_ABORTED. This only counts loads in "main frames" (it does not for example count the error codes for subresoures on a page). It excludes main frame navigations that are converted to downloads (unless they fail / are aborted before it's known that they would be a download), and requests handled externally (like mailto links).

histogram.name: Net.ErrorCodesForSubresources3
histogram.summary: Net error codes that requests for "subresources" end with, including net::OK and net::ERR_ABORTED.

histogram.name: Net.ErrorPageCounts
histogram.summary: Counts of various events that can occur on the network error page. Note that this histogram enum buckets are not mutually exclusive and so a single error page load might report samples into multiple ones. Each bucket has descriptions that further explain the context of their samples.

histogram.name: Net.ErrorPageCounts.SuggestionClicked
histogram.summary: Counts of the type of offline content suggestions clicked on the network error page. Reported upon click.

histogram.name: Net.ErrorPageCounts.SuggestionPresented
histogram.summary: Counts of the type of offline content suggestions shown on the network error page. Multiple suggestions can be shown at the same time. Reported when the suggestions are presented.

histogram.name: Net.ErrorPageCounts.WebAppAlternativeErrorPage
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times web apps receive `ERR_INTERNET_DISCONNECTED` and the alternative error page (rather than the dino) is shown. Reported when the error page html is being prepared. See `NetErrorHelper::GenerateLocalizedErrorPage` (crbug.com/1280518).

histogram.name: Net.Fetch.CheckPoint.BodyConsumerBase
histogram.summary: Records check points in the `BodyConsumerBase` class have been executed. This metrics is for investigating crbug.com/1431885.

histogram.name: Net.Fetch.CheckPoint.FetchManagerLoader
histogram.summary: Records check points in the `FetchManager::Loader` class have been executed. This metrics is for investigating crbug.com/1431885.

histogram.name: Net.HasBrokenNEON
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2023-01. The workaround is now effectively disabled in Chromium (but not Cronet, as of writing), and the latest Chromium-side metrics report 0.00% of devices are still affected.
histogram.summary: Records, on startup, for ARM devices running Android, whether the CPU is known to have a broken NEON unit. See https://crbug.com/341598.

histogram.name: Net.HttpAuthCount
histogram.summary: Per-authentication-scheme counts of HTTP authentication attempts and rejections.

histogram.name: Net.HttpAuthNtlmV2Usage
histogram.summary: Whether NTLMv2 was enabled for an authentication handshake. For a given data set the number of samples here is expected to be equivalent to the "NTLM Start" count in the "Net.HttpAuthCount" histogram. Note that NTLMv2 being enabled makes the client behavior equivalent to setting LmCompatibilityLevel to 3 or higher.

histogram.name: Net.HttpAuthPromptType
histogram.summary: Type of the HTTP auth prompt displayed.

histogram.name: Net.HttpAuthTarget
histogram.summary:
Per-authentication-scheme counts of HTTP authentication targets, such as secure servers or proxies.
Emitted at the same time as Net.HttpAuthCount, on every HTTP authentication attempt or rejection.

histogram.name: Net.HttpContentFreshnessLifetime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Length of time that a received resource will be cacheable.

histogram.name: Net.HttpContentLengthDifferenceWithValidOCL
histogram.summary: The difference between the size specified in the X-Original-Content-Length header and the size of the response body. Only includes resources that have the X-Original-Content-Length header.

histogram.name: Net.HttpContentLengthV2
histogram.summary: Size of the response body. This is the actual number of bytes received, which usually agrees with but is not necessarily the same as the size specified by the Content-Length header. Replaces Net.HttpContentLength, recording non-DRP Http traffic as "Http.Direct" instead of "Http.Other".

histogram.name: net.HttpIdentSrcURL
histogram.summary: Count of requests which contained a basic auth username and password embedded in the URL itself.

histogram.name: Net.HttpJob.CanIncludeCookies
histogram.summary: Counts the HTTP requests which involve reading from the cookie jar to construct a Cookie header vs. the HTTP requests which are disallowed from including a Cookie header.

histogram.name: Net.HttpJob.IpProtection.BytesSent
histogram.summary: Total bytes sent over the network for an HttpJob request that is covered by IP Protection. These bytes will be recorded even if the IP Protection proxy is configured as `direct://` (i.e. an IP Protection proxy is configured but doesn't actually proxy any traffic).

histogram.name: Net.HttpJob.IpProtection.PrefilterBytesRead.Net
histogram.summary: Total prefilter (e.g., before decompression) bytes read for an HttpJob request that is covered by IP Protection and served from the network. These bytes will be recorded even if the IP Protection proxy is configured as `direct://` (i.e. an IP Protection proxy is configured but doesn't actually proxy any traffic).

histogram.name: Net.HttpJob.IpProtection.TotalTimeNotCached
histogram.summary: Time it takes to complete an HttpJob that is covered by IP Protection, from starting the transaction until we are done reading, for jobs not served from the cache. This time will be recorded even if the IP Protection proxy is configured as `direct://` (i.e. an IP Protection proxy is configured but doesn't actually proxy any traffic).

histogram.name: Net.HttpJob.MainJobWaitTimeWithAvailableSpdySession
histogram.summary: Wait time of main job while there is an available SPDY session but no QUIC session.

histogram.name: Net.HttpJob.MainJobWaitTimeWithoutAvailableSpdySession
histogram.summary: Wait time of main job while there is no available SPDY session and no QUIC session.

histogram.name: Net.HttpJob.PrefilterBytesRead{Source}
histogram.summary: Total prefilter (e.g., before decompression) bytes read for an HttpJob request.

variant.name: .Cache
variant.summary: For requests served from the cache.

variant.name: .Net
variant.summary: For requests served from the network.

histogram.name: Net.HttpJob.ProxyTypeFailed
histogram.summary: Scheme of the proxy server used by an HTTP job that failed, or SCHEME_DIRECT if not proxy was used.

histogram.name: Net.HttpJob.ProxyTypeSuccess
histogram.summary: Scheme of the proxy server used by an HTTP job that succeeded, or SCHEME_DIRECT if not proxy was used.

histogram.name: Net.HttpJob.TotalTime
histogram.summary: Time it takes to complete an HttpJob, from starting the transaction until we are done reading.

histogram.name: Net.HttpJob.TotalTime.TLS13
histogram.summary: Time it takes to complete an HttpJob, from starting the transaction until we are done reading, if the response was received over TLS 1.3 and TCP. This is recorded to measure the impact of 0-RTT.

histogram.name: Net.HttpJob.TotalTime.TLS13.Google
histogram.summary: Time it takes to complete an HttpJob to a Google host, from starting the transaction until we are done reading, if the response was received over TLS 1.3 and TCP. This is recorded to measure the impact of 0-RTT.

histogram.name: Net.HttpJob.TotalTimeCached
histogram.summary: Time it takes to complete an HttpJob, from starting the transaction until we are done reading, for jobs served from the cache.

histogram.name: Net.HttpJob.TotalTimeCancel
histogram.summary: Time it takes to complete an HttpJob, from starting the transaction until the job is killed. Note that we didn't detect the end of the data for this job.

histogram.name: Net.HttpJob.TotalTimeNotCached
histogram.summary: Time it takes to complete an HttpJob, from starting the transaction until we are done reading, for jobs not served from the cache.

histogram.name: Net.HttpJob.TotalTimeSuccess
histogram.summary: Time it takes to complete an HttpJob, from starting the transaction until we are done reading, for jobs when we read until no more data is available.

histogram.name: Net.HttpOriginalContentLengthV2
histogram.summary:
Net.HttpOriginalContentLength with non-data reduction proxy traffic properly labeled with the "Direct" suffix.
Size specified in the X-Original-Content-Length header. If this header is not present in the response, the size of the response body is used. Replaces Net.HttpOriginalContentLength, breaking down traffic by Direct, ViaDRP, Bypassed, and Other.

histogram.name: Net.HttpOriginalContentLengthWithValidOCL
histogram.summary: Size specified in the X-Original-Content-Length header. Only includes resources that have the X-Original-Content-Length header.

histogram.name: Net.HttpProxy.ConnectLatency
histogram.summary: Time taken to establish the connection to the HTTP proxy. Note that the histogram expired briefly for M-86 and M-87 non-stable versions. Exact counts during that period may not be meaningful.

histogram.name: Net.HttpRequestHeaders.HeaderCount
histogram.summary:
The total number of headers for a net::HttpRequestHeaders object, recorded at destruction time. Because these objects are created and copied in many places and not necessarily sent over the network, this should not be considered an unbiased estimate of how many headers are sent in practice.
The purpose of this histogram is to measure the appropriate amount of memory to allocate for headers when the object is created. See https://crbug.com/1477132.

histogram.name: Net.HttpRequestStsState
histogram.summary: The HSTS status of top-frame HTTP/WS requests made by UrlRequestHttpJob. Requests with kProtectedHttp are immediately internally redirected to a secure request.

histogram.name: Net.HttpResponseCode
histogram.summary: The count of HTTP Response codes encountered.

histogram.name: Net.HttpServerProperties.CountOfServers
histogram.summary: The total number of ServerInfo structs written to the network service's prefs file, recorded each time the HttpServerProperties are serialized to update the copy stored on disk.

histogram.name: Net.HttpTimeToFirstByte
histogram.summary: Time from when an HTTP request is issued to when the first byte is processed.

histogram.name: Net.HttpTimeToFirstByte.TLS13
histogram.summary: Time from when an HTTP request is issued to when the first byte is processed, if the response was not cached and received over TLS 1.3 and TCP. This is recorded to measure the impact of 0-RTT.

histogram.name: Net.HttpTimeToFirstByte.TLS13.Google
histogram.summary: Time from when an HTTP request to a Google host is issued to when the first byte is processed, if the response was not cached and received over TLS 1.3 and TCP. This is recorded to measure the impact of 0-RTT.

histogram.name: Net.MediaCache.Response.EnabledOrDisabled
histogram.summary: Records decision points on whether response-side media content will be cached or not. This is determined after receiving the HTTP response headers and before attempting to write the the cache.

histogram.name: Net.NeedsHWCAP2Workaround
histogram.summary: Records, on startup, for ARM devices running Android, whether the kernel is missing AT_HWCAP2 from the ELF auxv and /proc/cpuinfo reports support for ARMv8 features. Those features should also be reported in AT_HWCAP2. This is to measure the workaround in https://crbug.com/boringssl/46.

histogram.name: Net.NetworkChangeNotifier.NewConnectionCost
histogram.summary: The new network connection cost any time a change to the device's active default network is observed.

histogram.name: Net.NetworkChangeNotifier.NewConnectionType
histogram.summary: The new network connection type any time a change to the device's active default network is observed.

histogram.name: Net.NetworkErrorLogging.SignedExchangeRequestOutcome
histogram.summary: When Network Error Logging observes a completed request of signed exchange that might generate a report, what happens to it. NEL observes all requests, both successful and unsuccessful. It sends reports for successful and unsuccessful requests at specified sampling rates so that error rates can be calculated. Insecure requests are discarded for having an insecure origin regardless of existence of a policy for the origin.

histogram.name: Net.NetworkTransaction{HostType}.RetryReason
histogram.summary: Log the reason when HttpNetworkTransaction retries.

histogram.name: Net.NumQuicSessionsAtShutdown
histogram.summary: The number of QUIC sessions when the QuicStreamFactory is destroyed.

histogram.name: Net.OnTransferSizeUpdated.Experimental.OverridenBy
histogram.summary: Records the number of times OnTransferSizeUpdated is called from different overriding methods. This UMA is useful to understand the distribution of calls being made to this method and will help see the reductions in IPC when we implement a prototype (b/257057692) where we remove unnecessary URLLoaderClient::OnTransferSizeUpdated IPCs.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyScriptFetcher.FirstByteDuration
histogram.summary: The time taken from requesting a PAC script to receiving the first byte of the response body on successful fetches. This does not include time spent doing proxy auto-discovery, or failed attempts at retrieving PAC scripts. If the response body was empty, this measures the total time to fetch the (empty) response body.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyScriptFetcher.SuccessDuration
histogram.summary: The time taken to successfully fetch a PAC script. This does not include time spent doing proxy auto-discovery, or failed attempts at retrieving PAC scripts.

histogram.name: Net.PublicKeyPinReportSendingFailure2
histogram.summary: A validated certificate chain may be subject to additional pinning requirements on a per-domain basis. When pinning requirements are violated, Chrome attempts to send a report about the incident. This records the net error code when sending a pinning violation report fails.

histogram.name: Net.PublicKeyPinSuccess
histogram.summary: A validated certificate chain may be subject to additional "pinning" requirements on a per-domain basis. This records the fraction of successful matches between a certificate chain and a pin list.

histogram.name: Net.PushedStreamVaryResponseHeader
histogram.summary: Information about the value of the Vary response header in HTTP/2 pushed streams.

histogram.name: Net.QuicActiveSessions
histogram.summary:
The number of active QUIC sessions before we activate a new QUIC session.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 09/12/2022 to 03/22/2023; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Net.QuicAltSvcFormat
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of QUIC alt-svc advertisements parsed by Chrome in Google format vs in IETF format.

histogram.name: Net.QuicChromiumClientStream.HandleOnCloseConnectionError
histogram.summary: Log the connection error code when QUIC stream handle closes.

histogram.name: Net.QuicChromiumClientStream.HandleOnCloseNetError
histogram.summary: Log the net error code when QUIC stream handle closes.

histogram.name: Net.QuicChromiumClientStream.HandleOnCloseStreamError
histogram.summary: Log the stream error code when QUIC stream handle closes.

histogram.name: Net.QuicChromiumClientStream.TrailingHeadersProcessSuccess
histogram.summary: Log success rate of processing trailing headers.

histogram.name: Net.QuicConnection.MultiPortPathCreationCancelled
histogram.summary: The reason for the existing path validation when a new multi-port path creation is attempted but failed because of existing validation.

histogram.name: Net.QuicConnection.MultiPortPathStatusWhenMigrating
histogram.summary: The status of the multi-port path when the client initiates the migration.

histogram.name: Net.QuicConnection.ServerAllowsActiveMigrationForMultiPort
histogram.summary: When multi-port is enabled, log whether the server allows active migration that's required for multi-port

histogram.name: Net.QuicConnection.WritePacketStatus
histogram.summary: The write result returned by the packet writer when the connection attempts to write a packet.

histogram.name: Net.QuicConnectivityMonitor.NumActiveDegradingSessions
histogram.summary:
The number of active sessions that are degrading on network changes. The suffix specifies the network change. Emitted when there are more than one active sessions.
The histogram is emitted when a network change happens which could affect the current default network, which includes the default network being changed, alternate networks being connected. It, however, doesn't emit when disconnecting an alternate network because that does not affect the current default network.

histogram.name: Net.QuicConnectivityMonitor.NumActiveQuicSessionsAtNetworkChange
histogram.summary:
The number of active QUIC sessions when a network change is detected. The suffix specifies the network change.
The histogram is emitted when a network change happens which could affect the current default network, which includes the default network being changed, alternate networks being connected. It, however, doesn't emit when disconnecting an alternate network because that does not affect the current default network.

histogram.name: Net.QuicConnectivityMonitor.NumAllDegradedSessions
histogram.summary:
The number of all sessions that detectes path degradation until a network change happens, including both active sessions and closed sessions. The suffix specifies the network change.
The histogram is emitted when a network change happens which could affect the current default network, which includes the default network being changed, alternate networks being connected. It, however, doesn't emit when disconnecting an alternate network because that does not affect the current default network.

histogram.name: Net.QuicConnectivityMonitor.NumAllSessionsDegradedAtNetworkChange
histogram.summary:
The total number of sessions that reports path degradation before a network change happens, including both still active sessions and closed sessions.
The histogram is emitted when a network change happens which could affect the current default network, which includes the default network being changed, alternate networks being connected. It, however, doesn't emit when disconnecting an alternate network because that does not affect the current default network.

histogram.name: Net.QuicConnectivityMonitor.NumSessionsTrackedSinceSpeculativeError
histogram.summary:
The number of total sessions that has been tracked since the first speculative error, including both active and closed sessions. Only recorded if non-zero.
The histogram is emitted when a network change happens which could affect the current default network, which includes the default network being changed, alternate networks being connected. It, however, doesn't emit when disconnecting an alternate network because that does not affect the current default network.

histogram.name: Net.QuicConnectivityMonitor.NumWriteErrorsSeenBeforeDegradation
histogram.summary:
The number of total sessions that has been closed due to QUIC_PACKET_WRITE_ERROR before first path degradation detection.
The histogram is emitted when session path degrading is detected for the first time on the current network and there was a session closed with a speculative signal (QUIC_PACKET_WRITE_ERROR).

histogram.name: Net.QuicConnectivityMonitor.PercentageActiveDegradingSessions
histogram.summary:
The percentage of active sessions that are degrading on network changes. The suffix specifies the network change. Emitted when there are at least two active sessions.
The histogram is emitted when a network change happens which could affect the current default network, which includes the default network being changed, alternate networks being connected. It, however, doesn't emit when disconnecting an alternate network because that does not affect the current default network.

histogram.name: Net.QuicConnectivityMonitor.PercentageAllDegradedSessions
histogram.summary:
The percentage of all sessions that detectes path degradation until a network change happens, including both active sessions and closed sessions. Always emit 0 when there is no session reporting path degrading to speculate a connectivity failure on the current network. The suffix specifies the network change.
The histogram is emitted when a network change happens which could affect the current default network, which includes the default network being changed, alternate networks being connected. It, however, doesn't emit when disconnecting an alternate network because that does not affect the current default network.

histogram.name: Net.QuicConnectivityMonitor.SessionDegradedBeforeWriteError
histogram.summary:
When a packet write error is detected by the session, if path degradation has been detected already on the same session.
The histogram is emitted when a session encounters a QUIC_PACKET_WRITE_ERROR and is soon to be closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicDiskCache.FailureReason
histogram.summary: Tracks failure reasons to read/load/write of QuicServerInfo to and from disk cache.

histogram.name: Net.QuicDroppedPacketReason
histogram.summary: The reason a QUIC packet could not be processed, logged for each dropped packet.

histogram.name: Net.QuicHandshakeNotConfirmedNumPacketsReceived
histogram.summary:
The number of QUIC packets received by a QUIC connection whose handshake was not confirmed when that connection is closed.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 09/12/2022 to 03/22/2023; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Net.QuicHandshakeState
histogram.summary: The state of a QUIC connection's crypto hanshake as it progresses from starting to confirmation or failure.

histogram.name: Net.QuicHttpStream.ProcessResponseHeaderSuccess
histogram.summary: Log the success rate of HTTP layer reading QUIC response headers, for investigating b/177893733.

histogram.name: Net.QuicHttpStream.ResponseStatus
histogram.summary: Stream error of QuicSpdyStream when QuicHttpStream::ComputeResponseStatus() returns ERR_QUIC_PROTOCOL_ERROR, for investigating b/177893733.

histogram.name: Net.QuicMultiPort.AltPortFailureWhenPathDegradingVsGeneral
histogram.summary: The percentage comparison between alternative port probe failure when default path is degrading and in general.

histogram.name: Net.QuicMultiPort.AltPortRttWhenPathDegradingVsGeneral
histogram.summary: The percentage comparison between alternative port response time when default path is degrading and response time in general.

histogram.name: Net.QuicMultiPort.NumDefaultPathDegrading
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by Net.QuicSession.NumDefaultPathDegrading in May 2023, as num_path_degrading is no longer specific to the multi-port feature.
histogram.summary: The number of time that a session which has multi-port enabled enters path-degrading state on the default path.

histogram.name: Net.QuicMultiPort.NumMultiPortFailureWhenPathDegrading
histogram.summary: The number of alternative port probing failure when the default path is degrading.

histogram.name: Net.QuicMultiPort.NumMultiPortFailureWhenPathNotDegrading
histogram.summary: The number of alternative port probing failure when the default path is healthy.

histogram.name: Net.QuicNetworkDegradingDurationTillConnected
histogram.summary: Time from when QUIC detects performance degradation on the current network to when QUIC notices a new network is connected.

histogram.name: Net.QuicNetworkDegradingDurationTillDisconnected
histogram.summary: Time from when QUIC detects performance degradation on the current network to when QUIC notices the current network is disconnected.

histogram.name: Net.QuicNetworkDegradingDurationTillNewNetworkMadeDefault
histogram.summary: The time from QUIC detecting network performance degradation to an alternative network becoming default.

histogram.name: Net.QuicNetworkDisconnectionDuration
histogram.summary: The time from network disconnection to an alternative network becoming default.

histogram.name: Net.QuicNumServerConfig.UpdateMessagesIgnored
histogram.summary: The number of times ServerConfigUpdateMessages ignored.

histogram.name: Net.QuicProtocolErrorRetryDelay{HostType}.{FinalResult}
histogram.summary: Log the retry delay caused by ERR_QUIC_PROTOCOL_ERROR. Recorded when HttpNetworkTransaction finishes.

histogram.name: Net.QuicProtocolError{HostType}.RetryStatus
histogram.summary: The status of how HttpNetworkTransaction handles a ERR_QUIC_PROTOCOL_ERROR. Recorded when HttpNetworkTransaction finishes.

histogram.name: Net.QuicProtocolError{HostType}.{RetryStatus}.QuicErrorCode
histogram.summary: Log the QUIC error code when HttpNetworkTransaction handles a ERR_QUIC_PROTOCOL_ERROR.

histogram.name: Net.QuicProtocolError{HostType}.{RetryStatus}.QuicStreamErrorCode
histogram.summary: Log the QUIC stream error code when HttpNetworkTransaction handles a ERR_QUIC_PROTOCOL_ERROR.

histogram.name: Net.QuicServerInfo.DiskCacheState
histogram.summary: The state of the QUIC server information when it's loaded from the disk cache.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.AbortedPendingStreamRequests
histogram.summary: The number of pending stream requests aborted when the session is closed. Pending streams are those which could not be created immediately because there were too many active streams.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.AcceptChForOrigin
histogram.summary: Records whether the QUIC session received an Accept-CH entry for the given origin, which GetAcceptChViaAlps() returns. Logged every time QuicHttpStream::GetAcceptChViaAlps() is called, typically once for each request that is served over HTTP/3.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.AcceptChFrameReceivedViaAlps
histogram.summary: Records both whether there are any valid origin fields and whether there are any invalid ones in the ACCEPT_CH frame. Logged during the TLS handshake of a QUIC connection if ALPS is negotiated, once for every ACCEPT_CH HTTP/3 frame received (possibly zero, typically not more than one).

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ActiveStreamsOnGoAwayAfterPathDegrading
histogram.summary: The number of active streams when the quic session decides to go away on path degrading.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.AsyncRead
histogram.summary:
True if the result of reading a packet from the network was ERR_IO_PENDING. Recorded for each packet when Read() returns.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 09/12/2022 to 03/22/2023; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.BlockedFrames.Received
histogram.summary: The number of BLOCKED frames recevied by a QuicSession when the session is closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.BlockedFrames.Sent
histogram.summary: The number of BLOCKED frames sent by a QuicSession when the session is closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.CertVerificationResult
histogram.summary: The network error code returned to a QUIC session from the CertVerifier when a certification verification is attempted.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.CertVerifierJob.CompleteTime
histogram.summary: Time spent verifying a certificate when racing cert veriifcation with host resolution.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ClientSideMtu
histogram.summary: The final maximum packet size of the connection used by the client before the session is closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.CloseAllSessionsError
histogram.summary: The network error code which resulted in all sessions being closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ClosedByPublicReset{HandshakeType}
histogram.summary: For a QUIC session that is closed by a public reset, where the handshake was {HandshakeType}, this boolean shows whether it is a public reset sent from a Google server or not.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ClosedByRtoAtClient.ReceivedPacketCount
histogram.summary: For a QUIC session that is closed by QUIC_TOO_MANY_RTOS at client, this is the number of packets it received before it is closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ClosedByRtoAtClient.SentPacketCount
histogram.summary: For a QUIC session that is closed by QUIC_TOO_MANY_RTOS at client, this is the number of packets it sent before it is closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ClosedDuringInitializeSession
histogram.summary: True if the QUIC session is closed during the call to InitializeSession, logged for each session just after InitializeSession is called.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.CloseSessionOnError
histogram.summary: The network error code which resulted in the session being closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.CoalesceStreamFrameStatus
histogram.summary: When a new stream frame is added to a QUIC packet, record whether it's coalesced with the existing stream frames.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.Connect
histogram.summary: Samples of the number of round-trips needed by a QUIC connection before a request could be sent by the client.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectAfterBroken
histogram.summary: True if a QUIC connection connected successfully after having been broken. Only emitted after a QUIC connection attempt to a server that was previous marked as broken.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectionClose.HandshakeFailureBlackHole.QuicError
histogram.summary: The QUIC error which caused a QUIC connection to be closed before the hanshake was confirmed, in the case where no packets were received. This provides a breakdown of the entires in Net.QuicSession.ConnectionClose.HandshakeNotConfirmed.Reason where the value is BLACK_HOLE.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectionClose.HandshakeFailureUnknown.QuicError
histogram.summary: The QUIC error which caused a QUIC connection to be closed before the hanshake was confirmed, in the case where at least 1 packet was received. This provides a breakdown of the entires in Net.QuicSession.ConnectionClose.HandshakeNotConfirmed.Reason where the value is UNKNOWN.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectionClose.HandshakeNotConfirmed.Reason
histogram.summary: The reason a QUIC handshake failed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectionClose.NumOpenStreams.HandshakeTimedOut
histogram.summary:
The number of streams open when a QUIC session crypto handshake timed out.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 09/12/2022 to 03/22/2023; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectionClose.NumOpenStreams.TimedOut
histogram.summary: The number of streams open when a QUIC session timed out.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectionClose.NumTotalStreams.HandshakeTimedOut
histogram.summary: The number of total streams created when a QUIC session crypto handshake timed out.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectionCloseErrorCodeServerIetfApplication{GQuicMissing}{ServerType}{HandshakeType}
histogram.summary: The QUIC application transport error code in a CONNECTION_CLOSE frame received from the server{GQuicMissing}. This is recorded for connections made to {ServerType}{HandshakeType}.

variant.name: GQuicErrorMissing
variant.summary: , when the GQUIC error was missing

variant.name: .HandshakeNotConfirmed
variant.summary: , where the handshake was not confirmed

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectionCloseErrorCodeServerIetfTransport{GQuicMissing}{ServerType}{HandshakeType}
histogram.summary:
The QUIC transport error code in a CONNECTION_CLOSE frame received from the server{GQuicMissing}. This is recorded for connections made to {ServerType}{HandshakeType}.
Warning: the ConnectionCloseErrorCodeServerIetfTransportGoogle variant was expired from 09/12/2022 to 03/22/2023; data may be missing.

variant.name: GQuicErrorMissing
variant.summary: , when the GQUIC error was missing

variant.name: .HandshakeNotConfirmed
variant.summary: , where the handshake was not confirmed

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectionCloseErrorCode{Closer}{ServerType}{HandshakeType}
histogram.summary: The QUIC error code which resulted in the QUIC connection being closed by the {Closer}. This is recorded for connections made to {ServerType}{HandshakeType}.

variant.name: .HandshakeNotConfirmed
variant.summary: , where the handshake was not confirmed

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectionDuration
histogram.summary: The duration of a QUIC connection starting from 1-RTT key available to connection close.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectionDurationWithPublicReset
histogram.summary: Duration of connections received PUBLIC_RESET.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectionFlowControlBlocked
histogram.summary: Whether QUIC session's connection is flow control blocked when a PING message is sent to server.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectionIpPooled
histogram.summary: True if an active session already exists for a given Ip during connection.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectionMigration
histogram.summary: The result of a QUIC connection migration attempt. The suffix specifies the cause of connection migration.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectionTypeFromPeer
histogram.summary: The IP Address family of this connection, as reported by the server.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectionTypeFromSelf
histogram.summary: The IP Address family of this connection, as seen locally.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectRandomPortRequiringConfirmation
histogram.summary: Samples of the number of round-trips needed by a QUIC connection before a request could be sent by the client, when handshake confirmation was required. (The operating system randomly selected a source port for the connection.)

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.CreationError
histogram.summary: Count of errors during attempts to create a QUIC session (before even using the session).

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.CryptoRetransmitCount.HandshakeConfirmed
histogram.summary: Times of retransmission time out of connections with successful handshake.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.CryptoRetransmitCount.HandshakeNotConfirmed
histogram.summary: Times of crypto retransmission timeout of connections with failed handshake.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.DrainingStreamsOnGoAwayAfterPathDegrading
histogram.summary: The number of draining streams when the quic session decides to go away on path degrading.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.DuplicatePacketsReceived
histogram.summary: The number of duplicate packets recevied by a QuicSession when the session is closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.EncryptionEstablishedTime
histogram.summary: The elapsed time between starting the crypto handshake and installing the first encryption key that can carry application data (either 0-RTT or 1-RTT).

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.FinalTcpCwnd
histogram.summary: The value of the TCP cubic sender's CWND when the session is closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.FinchConfigIsValid
histogram.summary:
Logged every time we parse a QUIC Finch config, and logs whether the config was valid. Invalid configs are most likely to be obsolete configs. Note that this is still logged (as true) when no variations config is present.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 09/12/2022 to 03/22/2023; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.FinchObsoleteVersion
histogram.summary: Triggered any time Finch configures an obsolete QUIC version. Only recorded when obsolete versions are not allowed (which is the default).

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.GapBetweenWriteErrorAndNetworkDisconnection
histogram.summary: This measures the time gap between the most recent write error and the network disconnection.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.GoAwayReceivedForConnectionMigration
histogram.summary: Whether QuicGoAwayFrame is received from server for connection migration due to client's port change. Logged when a QuicGoAwayFrame with error code QUIC_ERROR_MIGRATING_PORT is received.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.HandshakeConfirmedTime
histogram.summary: The elapsed time between starting the crypto handshake, and receiving confirmation from the server.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.HandshakeConfirmedTime.ECH
histogram.summary: The elapsed time between starting the crypto handshake, and receiving confirmation from the server, measured only for ECH-capable servers.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.HandshakeStatusOnConnectionMigration
histogram.summary: The handshake status when the session attempts to migrate the connection according to different migration causes.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.HandshakeStatusOnMigratingToServerPreferredAddress
histogram.summary: The handshake status when the session attempts to validate received server preferred address.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.HandshakeStatusOnPortMigration
histogram.summary: The handshake status when the session attempts to port migration on path degrading.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.HandshakeTimeout.PathDegradingDetected
histogram.summary: Whether path degrading has been detected by the time a QUIC connection is closed due to handshake timeout.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.HeaderCompressionRatioHpackReceived
histogram.summary:
Header compression ratio as percentage for received headers using HPACK.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 09/12/2022 to 03/22/2023; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.HeaderCompressionRatioHpackSent
histogram.summary:
Header compression ratio as percentage for sent headers using HPACK.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 09/12/2022 to 03/22/2023; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.HeaderCompressionRatioQpackReceived
histogram.summary:
Header compression ratio as percentage for received headers using QPACK.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 09/12/2022 to 03/22/2023; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.HeaderCompressionRatioQpackSent
histogram.summary: Header compression ratio as percentage for sent headers using QPACK.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.HostResolution.HandshakeConfirmedTime
histogram.summary: The elapsed time between the end of resolving the DNS name of the server for a QUIC connection, and receiving crypto handshake confirmation from the server. Logged after crypto handshake is confirmed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.IncorrectConnectionIDsReceived
histogram.summary: The number packets recevied by a QuicSession with an incorrect connection id when the sesesion is closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.InitialRttEsitmateSource
histogram.summary: The source for the initial RTT estimate recorded when a QUIC session is created.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.KeyUpdate.PerConnection2
histogram.summary: The number of key updates processed per connection, recorded on connection close. Only logged for connections which reached the 1-RTT level and supported key update.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.KeyUpdate.PotentialPeerKeyUpdateAttemptCount
histogram.summary: Count of packets received that appeared to attempt a key update but failed decryption which have been received since the last successfully decrypted packet, recorded on connection close. Only logged for connections which reached the 1-RTT level and supported key update.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.KeyUpdate.Reason
histogram.summary: The reason why each key update occured.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.KeyUpdate.Success.{Group}
histogram.summary: Records the success or failure of the last key update for connections where the key update was initiated by the {Group} side. Failure is defined as having sent at least one packet in the new key phase but never receiving an ack for any packet sent in the new key phase before the connection was closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.LastInFlightPacketSentTimeFromHandshakeCompletionWithPublicReset
histogram.summary: Time from handshake completion to last packet was sent for connections received PUBLIC_RESET.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.LastSentPacketContentBeforePublicReset
histogram.summary: A bitfield representing the last sent packet content before connection receives PUBLIC_RESET.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.MaxConsecutiveRtoWithForwardProgress
histogram.summary: Max consecutive retransmission timeout before making forward progress.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.MaxConsecutiveRtoWithForwardProgressAndBlackholeDetected
histogram.summary: Max consecutive retransmission timeout before making forward progress when blackhole has been detected.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.MaxReordering
histogram.summary: The maximum packet sequence number reordering observed by a QUIC connection.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.MaxReorderingTime
histogram.summary: The ratio of the maximum reordering time of a QUIC packet to the min rtt.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.MaxReorderingTimeLongRtt
